intro: Piaranthus cornutus, commonly known as the horned pincushion, is a unique flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring, often in clusters. Its distinctive feature is the presence of hooked bracts that resemble horns, giving it its common name. Piaranthus cornutus is a short-lived perennial, often found in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments.
